argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | sb5rf.1 | |- ( ph -> A. y ph ) |
| 2 |  | #P_sbequ1 | |- ( x = y -> ( ph -> [ y / x ] ph ) ) |
| 3 | 2 | #P_equcoms | |- ( y = x -> ( ph -> [ y / x ] ph ) ) |
| 4 | 3 | #P_com12 | |- ( ph -> ( y = x -> [ y / x ] ph ) ) |
| 5 | 1, 4 | #P_alrimih | |- ( ph -> A. y ( y = x -> [ y / x ] ph ) ) |
| 6 |  | #P_sb2 | |- ( A. y ( y = x -> [ y / x ] ph ) -> [ x / y ] [ y / x ] ph ) |
| 7 | 1 | #P_sbid2h | |- ( [ x / y ] [ y / x ] ph <-> ph ) |
| 8 | 6, 7 | #P_sylib | |- ( A. y ( y = x -> [ y / x ] ph ) -> ph ) |
| 9 | 5, 8 | #P_impbii | |- ( ph <-> A. y ( y = x -> [ y / x ] ph ) ) |
\
 Reversed substitution.  (Contributed by NM, 5-Aug-1993.)  (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 25-May-2011.)
